data.q: What is the primary benefit of using Semantic HTML tags like <main>, <nav>, and <article> instead of generic <div> tags?
o: They automatically apply CSS grid styling
They provide meaning to the browser and assistive technologies about the content's role
They make the HTML file size significantly smaller
They are required for JavaScript to interact with the DOM
data.e: Semantic tags describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer, which helps screen readers navigate the page and improves SEO.

data.q: Which tag is the most appropriate for a standalone piece of content that could be independently distributed or reused, such as a blog post or a news story?
o: <section>
<div>
<article>
<body>
data.e: The <article> element represents a complete, self-contained composition in a document, page, or site.

data.q: How does using proper semantic heading levels (<h1> through <h6>) impact SEO and accessibility?
o: It determines the default font size in the browser
It creates a logical document outline used by screen readers and search engine crawlers
It is used by the browser to prioritize image loading
It has no impact on SEO, only on visual layout
data.e: Search engines and screen readers use headings to understand the structure and hierarchy of the page content. Skipping levels can confuse these tools.

data.q: What is the correct use of the <figure> and <figcaption> elements?
o: To group any set of <div> elements together
To wrap images, diagrams, or code snippets along with an explanatory caption
To create a sidebar for navigation links
To define the main header of a webpage
data.e: <figure> is used to encapsulate self-contained content, and <figcaption> provides a textual description for that content.

data.q: Which attribute should be added to an tag to ensure it is accessible to users with visual impairments?
o: title
src
alt
id
data.e: The 'alt' (alternative text) attribute is read aloud by screen readers to describe the image content to users who cannot see it.

data.q: What does the ARIA attribute 'role="button"' do when applied to a <div>?
o: It automatically adds a click event listener
It styles the div to look like a button
It tells assistive technologies to treat the div as a button
It makes the div keyboard-focusable by default
data.e: ARIA roles provide metadata to assistive technologies, but they do not add default browser behaviors like keyboard focus or event handling. Native <button> tags are always preferred.

data.q: Which tag should be used to wrap the primary navigation links of a website?
o: <ul>
<menu>
<nav>
<header>
data.e: The <nav> element is a landmark that allows screen reader users to jump directly to the navigation section of a page.

data.q: Why is it better to use <button> instead of <div onclick="..."> for clickable elements?
o: Buttons have native keyboard accessibility (Tab and Enter support)
Divs cannot have click events in modern browsers
Buttons are faster to render in the DOM
Divs are reserved only for layout, never for interaction
data.e: Native buttons are keyboard-accessible out of the box. Using a div requires extra work (tabindex and keydown listeners) to achieve the same level of accessibility.

data.q: In the context of SEO, what is the 'main' landmark used for?
o: To identify the navigation bar
To wrap the logo and site title
To identify the unique, primary content of the document
To define the copyright section at the bottom
data.e: The <main> tag helps search engines identify the core content of a page, ignoring headers, footers, and sidebars that repeat across the site.

data.q: Which element is specifically intended to contain contact information for its nearest <article> or <body> ancestor?
o: <footer>
<address>
<contact>
<aside>
data.e: The <address> element is specifically used to provide contact information for the author or owner of the document or article.

data.q: What is the purpose of the <time> element?
o: To display a live clock on the page
To represent a specific period in time or a date in a machine-readable format
To set a timeout for a JavaScript function
To measure how long a user stays on a page
data.e: Using <time datetime="2024-01-01"> allows browsers and search engines to parse dates and times accurately regardless of how they are formatted visually.

o: A tooltip that appears on hover
A text string that labels an element when no visible text is present
The CSS class name for the element
A way to translate the text into different languages
data.e: aria-label is used when an element has no visible text (like an icon-only button) to provide a descriptive name for screen readers.
